Constructor & Destructor Documentation

cfgfile::cfgfile (  ) 

Default constructor: Constructs the Object with default values: Token for comments: # Read Only file assignment token: =

cfgfile::cfgfile ( const std::string &  filepath,
bool  is_writeable 
)

Constructs the object and opens a config file. The User can specify if the file should be opened with write-access. Comment token is #

Parameters:
filepath Path to the config-file
is_writeable specifies rw/ro

Here is the call graph for this function:

string cfgfile::get_cfg_value ( const std::string &  cfg_identifier  ) 

Returns a configuration options found in a file.

Parameters:
cfg_identifier specifies the configruation option to search for
Returns:
Configuration value, or, if none found or no file is opened, an empty string

void cfgfile::open_cfg_file ( const std::string &  filepath,
bool  writeable 
)

Opens the cfgfile, if the object was constructed without specifying one. Also, the file can be changed, if there is already one opened.

Parameters:
filepath Path to the config-file
writeable specifies rw/ro

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void cfgfile::reload_file (  ) 

reloads the file to make changes visible

Here is the caller graph for this function:

bool cfgfile::set_cfg_value ( const std::string &  cfg_identifier,
const std::string &  cfg_value 
)

Sets a configuration option. If the identifier already exists, the value is changed. Else, the option is appended.

Parameters:
cfg_identifier Identifier to search for/add
cfg_value the value that should be set
Returns:
true on success, else false

Get writeable status

Returns:
